alert.note: Alert for Johnston (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 03 at 12:30PM EST until January 06 at 8:31AM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Raleigh NC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in North Carolina... Neuse River At Smithfield affecting Johnston County. For the Neuse River...including Clayton and Smithfield...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Neuse River At Smithfield. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning to Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Flooding begins along the Neuse Riverwalk. Water nears the base of the holding tank at the water treatment plant. At 18.0 feet, The Smithfield town park and the Neuse Riverwalk at the US70 bridge are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM EST Monday the stage was 10.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 17.3 feet early Wednesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Fri Neuse River Smithfield 15.0 10.2 Mon 11 am ES 16.3 16.5 10.6 7.5 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued late tonight by 1230 AM EST.
